title: Elderyoung
author: Elderyoung
content: Bola Ahmed Tinubu as president elect engaged Nigerians with an 80-page manifesto which he titled “Renewed Hope”. I would be surprised if he has read his own manifesto. It took some time for that manifesto to be announced.His campaign managers disowned several versions before they finally decided on the 88-page document. Now here is the deal – in Nigeria, political manifestoes are written by a hired team who put out textbook ideas and tell the people what they want to hear which is why all the presidential manifestoes in the 2023 presidential election mouthed the same platitudes, an expression of the lack of clear ideological lines in contemporary Nigerian politics.

comments.author: Similificator
comments.body: The thing about politicians is that most of these people or their script writers only talk about things that they know people would love to hear regardless of it being logical/achievable or not. Most of the time in politics, the main goal is to garner as much attention and blind compassion as they can from the masses that would help them succeed in their campaigns and probably winning and achieving their wanted positions. It is pretty rare nowadays to see manifestos that are realistic and truly possible to achieve from politicians. Most have become just sugarcoated crap and empty promises that are just created for the sake of having something to say. Well, that's politics for you.

comments.author: Strongkored
comments.body: That’s what politicians all over the world do, even though many of the ideas in it are not the idea of the politician himself and even if he doesn’t understand how to implement it, which he does just speak and keep speaking to be able to attract many voters to become his voters. The outcast politicians would not even be able to fulfill every promise made in his campaigns—per if it could be fulfilled 50% would be very good but his dryness under it would even do the opposite of what he once promised. What can the people do to such an elected president? I think there’s nothing but going on living and working well to improve our lives because hoping that the President will change our situation is just a dream.

This statement is just an indirect means to tell the citizen not to expect anything from this government since the tenure has been shared and how any person rule his own doesn't matter to anybody, this kind of can only come from Africa because of the haplessness of their citizens, if it were to be developed nations once you make this kind of statement you will be disqualified because it means since is your turn if you are not given the opportunity to rule, you will do anything to get the position which nobody knows what the way will look like and such way might cause insecurity even though you might be arrested by then somethings unusual might have happened.It is so disheartening to have come across this kind of politicians that is reckless in thinking that want to grab power by all means .

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Every political candidates will alwa give the usual promises once they are in pursuit of their ambition but things don't happen the way they expect at the long run because the people will always made complaints concerning their performance, they will also act less to expectations because they have many of those they owe an appreciation for contributing to their imminent success in politics, alot or funds meant for the nation building may be diverted to other sociocultural affairs among some particular set of people leaving others behind, the president may wish well hut those surrounding him will not just allow.

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: Elderyoung on May 14, 2023, 05:37:48 PMNow here is the deal – in Nigeria, political manifestoes are written by a hired team who put out textbook ideas and tell the people what they want to hear which is why all the presidential manifestoes in the 2023 presidential election mouthed the same platitudes, an expression of the lack of clear ideological lines in contemporary Nigerian politics. Who cares about the political manifesto of African politicians? They cannot be held accountable for failure to abide by them by anybody or any institution. So they can include fantasies and blue elephant projects just to make the electorate feel good. The current president of Nigeria promised to make the Naira strong until it becomes equal to the dollar. The Naira was about N170 when he became president now it is about N750. I have stopped listening to their political folktales and stories because they are all empty promises. Their ideology is to promote corruption and steal from the people. I have learned not to depend on these empty promises and focus on how to take care of myself and my family.
